name: places/ChIJSfIsXc5bwokRP--69NONeUc
formattedAddress: 185 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10007, USA
adrFormatAddress: 185 Greenwich St, New York, NY 10007, USA

originalText.text:
I recently had the pleasure of visiting this store that sells marvelous gadgets, and I have to say, I was thoroughly impressed. From the moment I walked in, I was greeted with a warm welcome from the friendly staff, who were knowledgeable and eager to help.

The store itself was well-organized and easy to navigate, with a wide variety of gadgets to choose from.

What really stood out to me, though, was the quality of the products on offer. Each item was carefully selected for its unique features and high level of functionality, making it clear that this store values quality over quantity.

Overall, I had an exceptional experience at this store, and I would highly recommend it to anyone in the market for some top-notch gadgets. The staff, selection, and quality of products all exceeded my expectations, and I will definitely be returning in the future.

originalText.text: Awesome toy store BUT those grays and blacks are awful. Those are adult colors. This place should be vibrant with yellows, reds, oranges and schematics (hands-on touch displays of toys kids can actually play with). Think how amazing and bright Toys "R" Us was but 2.0 for the 21st century. What I see here is an adult kids toy store, not something a child or a little older kid would love to visit for the sake of the store itself. Differentiate yourself by making your store fun.

originalText.text: This store for kids seems to think it appropriate to blast absolutely the filthiest, most expletive laden music imaginable. I don't know what in what world this is appropriate music to be playing in *any* store, let alone one with action figures and Mario games. Give me a break.

originalText.text:
I walked into the empty store and the salesperson wouldn't look me in the face. When I went to look at the Funkos next to the cashier, he said very friendly: "Don't approach".
If I can't look, I can't buy.
Bad service, bad store.
